trans-unit.source: Enables nested components such as content pages and user controls to add script and service references to pages when a <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptManager"></xref> control is already defined in a parent element.
In this topic:
[Introduction](#introduction)
[Declarative Syntax](#declarative_syntax)
Introduction
A Web page can contain only one <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManager> control, either directly on the page or indirectly inside a nested or parent component.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManagerProxy> control lets you add scripts and services to content pages and to user controls if the master page or host page already contains a <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManager> control.
When you use the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManagerProxy> control, you can add to the script and service collections defined by the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManager> control.

If you do not want to include specific scripts and services on every page that includes a particular <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManager> control, you can remove them from the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManager> control.
You can then add them to individual pages by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManagerProxy> control instead.
Declarative Syntax
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptManagerProxy"></xref> class.
A page that contains a <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManagerProxy> control must also contain a valid <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManager> control.
For example, if you are putting a <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManagerProxy> control on a content page, the page must reference a master page that contains a <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManager> control.
There is no <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptManager"></xref> for the current page.
\- or -
The current page is `null`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.AuthenticationServiceManager"></xref> object that is associated with the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptManagerProxy"></xref> instance.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.AuthenticationServiceManager> object that is returned by this property represents the authentication service that is registered with the page.
You can use the ASP.NET authentication service or use a custom authentication service.
To use a custom service, you can register it by including a `AuthenticationService` element inside the `ScriptManagerProxy` element on the page.
You can also programmatically configure the <xref:System.Web.UI.AuthenticationServiceManager> object.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.AuthenticationServiceManager"></xref> object for the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptManagerProxy"></xref> instance.
Gets a reference to the composite script that supports the content page.
A reference to the composite script.
Occurs when the user clicks the browser's **Back** or **Forward** button.
When a user clicks the browser's **Back** button, the browser navigates through previously-viewed URLs, which can include URLs that contain history-point state data.
If client code in the Web page detects that the URL contains history state data, it makes a request to the server page.
This acts as a postback event, and the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManagerProxy> server control raises the `Navigate` event.
You can handle this event and re-create the page as required in the Web application by using the state data that is passed with the event.

Raises the base <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.Init"></xref> event and registers the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptManagerProxy"></xref> control with the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptManager"></xref> control.
The event data.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ProfileServiceManager"></xref> object that is associated with the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptManagerProxy"></xref> instance.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.ProfileServiceManager> object that is returned by this property represents the profile service that is registered with the page.
You can use the ASP.NET profile service or use a custom profile service.
To use a custom service, you can register it by including a `ProfileService` element inside the `ScriptManagerProxy` element on the page.
You can also programmatically configure the <xref:System.Web.UI.ProfileServiceManager> object.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.ProfileServiceManager"></xref> object for the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptManagerProxy"></xref> instance.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.RoleServiceManager"></xref> object that is associated with the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptManagerProxy"></xref> instance.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.RoleServiceManager> object that is returned by this property represents the role service that is registered with the page.
You can use the ASP.NET role service or use a custom role service.
To use a custom service, you can register it by including a `RoleService` element inside the `ScriptManagerProxy` element on the page.
You can also programmatically configure the <xref:System.Web.UI.RoleServiceManager> object.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.RoleServiceManager"></xref> object for the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptManagerProxy"></xref> instance.

Gets a <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptReferenceCollection"></xref> object that contains a <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptReference"></xref> object for each script file that is explicitly registered with the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptManagerProxy"></xref> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManagerProxy.Scripts%2A> collection enables you to add script references to any scripts that are already registered with the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManager> control.
You can add script references to the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManagerProxy.Scripts%2A> collection declaratively by using the `ScriptReference` element.
You can add script references programmatically by adding <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptReference> objects to the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManagerProxy.Scripts%2A> collection.
If a script is already registered with the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManagerProxy> or <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManager> control, the script is not registered again.
A collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptReference"></xref> objects for each script file that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptManagerProxy"></xref> control sends to the browser.

Gets a <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptReferenceCollection"></xref> object that contains a <xref href="System.Web.UI.ServiceReference"></xref> object for each service that is explicitly registered with the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptManagerProxy"></xref> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManagerProxy.Services%2A> collection enables you to add services to any services that are already registered with the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManager> control.
You can add service references to the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManagerProxy.Services%2A> collection declaratively by using the `ServiceReference` element.
You can add service references programmatically by adding <xref:System.Web.UI.ServiceReference> objects to the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManagerProxy.Services%2A> collection.
If a service is already registered with the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManagerProxy> or <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManager> control, the service is not registered again.
A collection that contains an <xref href="System.Web.UI.ServiceReference"></xref> object for each service that is registered with the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptManagerProxy"></xref> control.
Overrides the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.Visible"></xref> property inherited from the base <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control"></xref> class to prevent setting this value.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Visible%2A> property is overridden in the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManagerProxy> class to prevent setting this property.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManagerProxy.Visible%2A> property returns `true` unless it is inside a container, such as a <xref:System.Web.UI.UserControl> whose <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Visible%2A> property is set to `false`.
`true` if the control is rendered on the page; otherwise, `false`.
A value is assigned to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptManagerProxy.Visible"></xref> property.
